predefined_profiles.name: Old Deng
predefined_profiles.public profile: Male, a manager at a company, Haixing is his wife
predefined_profiles.goal: Find the true cause of Haixing's death (why there was a rope around her neck)
predefined_profiles.private profile: He has psychological issues and killed Haixing after she discovered his embezzlement of company funds. To cover up the truth of killing Haixing, he fabricated the character Xiao Liu, making Xiao Liu the one who embezzled the funds and killed Haixing.

predefined_profiles.name: Haixing
predefined_profiles.public profile: Female, Old Deng's wife, virtuous, makes breakfast for Old Deng every day, usually goes to practice yoga
predefined_profiles.goal: Make Old Deng turn himself in to the police
predefined_profiles.private profile: She discovered Old Deng's embezzlement of company funds

scenario: On a typical morning, the alarm clock rings, and Old Deng wakes up from his slumber. In his half-asleep state, he sees the time on his phone as 08:48. It's time to get up and go to work, and Old Deng turns off the alarm.

profile.name: Xiao Liu
profile.public profile: Male, subordinate to Old Deng in the company, taking leave for personal reasons on a typical day
profile.private profile: A fictional character created by Old Deng. In fact, everything Xiao Liu does is actually done by Old Deng, including embezzling public funds and murdering Haixing
profile.goal: To conceal the embezzlement of public funds

profile.name: Xiao Wang
profile.public profile: Male, subordinate to Old Deng in the company
profile.goal: To complete the tasks assigned by his boss and live a peaceful life

dialog.content: It's an ordinary morning. The alarm goes off, and Old Deng wakes up from his slumber. Half-asleep, he sees the time on his phone: 08:48. It's time to get up and go to work. Old Deng turns off the alarm.
Alright, I know, I'm getting up now. (Walks to the kitchen and sees Haixing cooking) What's for breakfast today?
Your favorite - Century Egg and Lean Pork Porridge. Why are you standing there? Go freshen up so you won't be late for work again.
Okay, okay, I'm going.
Ah! (Screams in pain as her foot hits a chair)
What happened? Are you okay?
It's nothing, don't worry. Go freshen up, I'll be fine after a moment.
Really nothing?
No worries.
Alright then. (Old Deng goes to the bathroom to freshen up. In the living room, after breakfast, Haixing tidies Old Deng's clothes)
(Haixing buttons up Old Deng's shirt) There, all set.
I'm off to work then.
Come home early.
I'll be back right after work.
Supervisor, Xiao Liu has taken personal leave today and needs your approval.
Just leave it there, I got it.
(Places the leave request on Old Deng's desk) Alright.

(After work, Old Deng returns home. He unlocks the door with his key card only to find Haixing lifelessly lying on the floor. A thin rope is around her neck, seemingly the murder weapon.) Haixing! Ah! (Alarm rings, Old Deng wakes up from his sleep. The scene of Haixing's body lying in front of him still flashes before his eyes, blurring reality. He hurriedly throws off the blanket to verify what happened, only to find Haixing safe and sound, cooking breakfast for him in the kitchen as usual.)
You're up? Why are you standing there? Go freshen up!
Oh oh oh, alright... was that just a dream?
(Once again screams in pain as her foot hits the chair) Ah! This damned chair! (Haixing turns back to see Old Deng standing like a statue.) Why are you standing there like a log? Go freshen up!

content.content: (Mumbling) That must have been a dream. Haixing is alive and well, right? Just need to freshen up and head to work!
(Sighs) Even though Haixing is gone, life must go on. I need to freshen up and work hard. Maybe tomorrow will be better.
(Bitter smile) Haixing is gone, what a blow. But I still have to freshen up and go to work as if nothing happened.
(Talking to himself) With Haixing gone, it's truly awful. But I must pull myself together, freshen up, and try to complete today's work.

question: #question#What can Old Deng say to show his optimism in this situation?

content.content: Did Haixing just stub her toe? How strange, it seemed to happen in the dream too. As her husband, I should stay home today to protect her!
Haixing doesn't look well today; maybe she didn't sleep well last night. As her husband, I should show more care and cook her a nice meal.
Haixing, you shouldn't go out today. The weather isn't good, maybe it'll rain. As your husband, I want you to be safe, so just stay home and rest today.
Haixing, you seem a bit preoccupied today. Is something bothering you? As your husband, I hope you can share with me. Oh, I have an important meeting today; I might come home late.

question: #question#What should Old Deng say to show his sense of responsibility in protecting Haixing?

dialog.content: (fastening Lao Deng’s buttons) There, that’s better.
I'm off to work now.
Come back early, okay?
Supervisor, Xiao Liu has requested personal leave today. Could you approve it?
What did you just say?
I just said Xiao Liu requested personal leave... Supervisor? Are you alright?

content.content: (shocked) Leave!? If I remember correctly, Xiao Liu also requested leave the day Haixing was killed! If it’s true, then... no, no, it must be fake, it’s definitely fake!
(shocked) My god! Xiao Liu also requested leave the day Haixing was killed! This is terrifying, I need to tell the police immediately.
(shocked) Xiao Liu requested leave the day Haixing was killed? Could it be a coincidence? I need to think this through, there must be some secret behind it.
(shocked) Xiao Liu requested leave the day Haixing was killed! This can’t be true, I must have misheard. I need to calm down, take a deep breath, and this will all pass.

question: #question#How can Lao Deng express his way of regulating fear and panic in a stressed situation?

content.content: Xiao Liu took leave? This is bad, too many coincidences. If everything is true, then Haixing is in danger! I must get home to protect her now!!
Xiao Liu took leave? This is bad, too many coincidences. If everything is true, then Haixing is in danger! But I still have work to finish, I need to complete it before going home.
Xiao Liu took leave? This is bad, too many coincidences. If everything is true, then Haixing is in danger! I need to tell the boss quickly, then we can go protect her together.

Xiao Liu took leave? This is bad, too many coincidences. If everything is true, then Haixing is in danger! I need to go to the supermarket first to buy a few things before getting home to check on the situation.

question: #question#How can Lao Deng make it clear he's decided to go home?

dialog.content: No worries, no worries, I was just thinking about something. You go ahead and do your work.
Alright, Supervisor.
(Old Deng comes home from work, swiping his card to open the door) Starfish! Ah! (Old Deng lets out a cry of fear and grief)
Starfish lies lifeless on the ground, a hemp rope around her neck, appearing to be the weapon that strangled her.
Supervisor?
(snapping out of his panic) It's nothing, really. Something urgent came up at home, I need to go back!

Old Deng sprinted home and met Xiao Liu at the entrance of the apartment building. He was hurrying towards Old Deng's house. Old Deng rushed back, only to discover that Haixing was lying lifeless on the floor, a thin cord around her neck, seeming to be the murder weapon.
Why are you still standing there?

Okay, okay, I'll wash up right away. (Enters the bathroom, makes a phone call) Hello, is this Xiao Wang? I'm not feeling well today, I need to take a day off. Could you help me submit my leave note to HR?
Ah, you're taking a day off too? I'll take both your leave note and Xiao Liu's to the HR department in a bit.
What's up with Xiao Liu, why is he taking a day off too?
I don't know, he just said he had something to take care of, but didn't really explain.
Alright, I got it.
(At the dining table) Eat more.
Well, I'm not going to work today.
What's wrong? Did something happen?

content.content: I have to tell you something really bizarre. It might have been a dream, but then again, maybe not... In any case, everything that happened today matched that eerie dream!
I encountered something very strange today, and it reminded me of our childhood adventures.
I have to tell you, I met a very intriguing person today, who shared an incredible story with me.
I must tell you, while I was working today, everything suddenly seemed so unreal, as if I was being sucked into an unknown whirlpool.

question: #question# How should Old Deng tell Haixing about his encounter?

content.content: Nothing's wrong, nothing happened. I'm just not feeling very well, and I want to stay home and rest.
It's nothing major really. I've just been feeling a bit stressed with work lately, so I want to go out and relax a bit.
I'm actually feeling fine today, nothing wrong, but I'd like to take a day off to handle some personal matters at home.
I do feel a bit unwell today, but I'm planning to hit the gym and sweat it out; that might help me feel better.

question: #question# What should Old Deng say to express he wants to stay home to regulate his energy?

dialog.content: What dream?
You're going to die today!
Are you under a lot of stress lately?
I don't even know if it was a dream or not...
Oh come on, I'm perfectly fine! You're just too stressed.
Why don't you believe me?
Alright, alright, I believe you.
(Following Haixing to the kitchen) You really don't look like you believe me...

Didn't I just say I believe you? Move out of the way. (Haixing pushes Old Deng aside, crouching down to open the cupboard) ...I'm in a rush to get to my yoga class, and you're blocking the way. (She sees a bundle of rope inexplicably in the cupboard and picks it up) How many times have I told you, don't leave things lying around! Why would you put a rope in the cupboard?
I didn't put it there! We don't even have rope at home, and how does this rope...
What's with the rope?
It looks just like the one that was around your neck when you died.
Was it Xiao Liu who killed me?
I don't know, I really don't know. But why would Xiao Liu want to kill you? Maybe you shouldn't go out today; I'll stay home and protect you.
Then I'll call my coach and tell him I'm skipping yoga today.
Okay. (Phone rings) Hello?
Hey Supervisor, the manager is asking why the quarterly report hasn't been sent yet?
Oh, Xiao Liu already sent it to me. I'll forward it to the manager in a bit.
Alright.
(Walks into the study, sees a hard drive next to his computer) What's this?
What do you mean 'what's this'? Don't you know your own stuff? Does it have anything to do with me supposedly dying?

content.content: How could it be, silly cat? Don't worry, this hard drive never appeared in my dream! Let's check it out together!
Haixing, don't worry. I know you're really stressed lately, but what's in this hard drive will definitely not disappoint you.
Haixing, I know you're anxious, but I've already checked the contents of this hard drive. There's nothing that will make you uncomfortable.
Haixing, don't be scared. I’ve already looked through the hard drive's contents; I promise you won't feel uneasy. Let's explore its secrets together!

question: #question# How should Old Deng speak to comfort Haixing and make her feel at ease?

content.content: This? With so much work to handle, how can I possibly remember everything clearly? Stop worrying unnecessarily, go take a rest, I'll join you once I'm done.
Actually, I did mess up some things, but it's not something you should worry about. I'll handle it.
Yeah, work's been a bit much, but I've got it all stored up here. You don't need to worry about it; I'll sort it out.
There's quite a lot going on at work, but how could I remember everything perfectly? Stop worrying, I've got it under control.

question: #question# How should Old Deng persuade Haixing?

dialog.content: Whoa, isn't that Xiao Liu?
What's he doing?
This is evidence of Xiao Liu embezzling funds! I, I wasn't too sure at first, but...
But what?
This evidence might be related to your death... (there's a knock at the door)
What do we do? Someone's knocking on the door?!
(peeking through the peephole) Oh no, it's Xiao Liu!
What do we do then?

content.content: Oh no, it's Xiao Liu. If he comes in and something bad happens, we're screwed! Calm down, let's hide quickly!
Oh no, it's Xiao Liu. Since he's here, I should entertain him well. Let's prepare some refreshments to make him feel at home!
Ah, Xiao Liu is here. He's always so enthusiastic. We should quickly go out and welcome him, so he doesn't wait too long.
Not good, Xiao Liu is here, and every time he comes, he brings trouble. We need to find a way to get him to leave quickly.

question: #question# What should Lao Deng say to demonstrate his fear of Xiao Liu visiting his house?

content.content: Xiao Liu? He must have his reasons; we need to ask him and find out what's really going on!
Xiao Liu? I'm not sure, his behavior has been a bit suspicious lately; we might need to investigate.
Xiao Liu? He's always so reliable, I trust that he can handle this without us needing to intervene much.
Xiao Liu? I heard he's been through some trouble recently, but we should keep our distance and not get involved.

question: #question# What should Lao Deng say to show his trust in Xiao Liu?

dialog.content: Where are we hiding?
The bedroom! Go!
Oh my god, how does he have the house key?
Shh!

Xiao Liu walked into the bedroom to search. Haixing, frightened, made a noise, catching Xiao Liu's attention. He approached Old Deng and Haixing with a knife, resulting in both Old Deng and Haixing's deaths.
Don’t do anything reckless!
He's been working for me for so long, I feel like I know what kind of person he is! (says this as he walks towards the door)
Open the door!
(opens the door) Xiao Liu, I have something very important to discuss with you!
Xiao Liu opens the door and directly stabs Old Deng to death.
Alright! Finally done! (knocking sound)
Who is it?
Is it Xiao Liu?
Hey, why not open the door for me?
Old Deng tries to stop Starfish, but fails. Starfish opens the door and gets knocked out by Xiao Liu.
Where do you feel unwell? How about I stay home with you!
Thank you, it's so good to have you!
We've been together for so long; why say such things! I'll tell the coach I'm skipping yoga today.
Alright. (Walks to the balcony to water the plants), Hmm? Why does it look like someone's already watered them?

content.content: Haixing, come look at this flower. I remember you didn't water it this morning!
Haixing, come look at this flower. I remember I didn't water it this morning!
Haixing, come look at this flower. I watered it yesterday, so it should be your turn today, right?
Haixing, come look at this flower. I heard you watered it this morning; well done!

question: #question# What should Old Deng say to show he's actively asking Haixing about the watering?

content.content: It must have been Haixing who watered them in the morning. She's really hardworking, cooking for me and taking care of the house. I must love her dearly from now on.
I guess it was Haixing who watered the plants last night. She's always so thoughtful. But I should remind her not to overwork herself; I should help with the chores.
These flowers look great; Haixing is really diligent. But I have to say, she should spend more time on herself instead of always doing housework.
Haixing is a genius, even watering the plants seamlessly. I should tell her to leave these small tasks to me in the future; she should focus on more important things.

question: #question# What should Old Deng say to reflect upon seeing the watered flowers and empathize with Haixing's hard work at home?

dialog.content: Yeah, I didn't water the flowers this morning. What's up?
Then come see what's going on here!
What do you mean by that?
No one else has been in the house, right?
I don't think so!

content.content: Then he's in our house! What should we do? Haixing might get killed by him, and so might I. Haixing, let's run! ... No, no, calm down. Panicking won't help right now...
Then he's in our house! What should we do? Haixing might get killed by him, and so might I. Haixing, we have to find a place to hide first and then figure things out.

Then he's in our house! What should we do? Haixing might get killed by him, and so might I. Haixing, we need to act immediately, find a weapon, and prepare to defend ourselves! ... Okay, maybe we should just take a deep breath and think of a safer plan.

Then he's in our house! What should we do? Haixing might get killed by him, and so might I. Haixing, we should quickly call the police and let them handle it! ... But maybe we should try to figure out something ourselves first since the police might take some time to arrive.

question: #question#What can Old Deng say to show he is trying to control his impulses in a panic?

content.content: (whispering to Haixing) This means there's definitely someone else in our house! We need to leave before they realize we've noticed them!
(excitedly to Haixing) Wow, look, the flowers have been watered, it must have been the neighbors helping out! We should go thank them.
(puzzlingly to Haixing) How come the flowers have been watered? Did we forget to turn off the faucet yesterday? We should check the pipes.
(casually to Haixing) The flowers are watered, looks like we don’t have to worry about them wilting. Let's continue with what we were doing.

question: #question#What can Old Deng say to demonstrate his information processing skills upon realizing the flowers have been watered?

dialog.content: What are we going to do now?
We need to stay calm! Let's check if there's anyone at home...
Go see if he's in our house? That's ridiculous!
It's our only option right now!
Old Deng was knocked out by Xiao Liu when he opened the study door. Old Deng grabbed Xiao Liu, allowing Haixing to escape.
(whispering) Alright! I'll listen to you!
Hurry and do that thing...
What? (Old Deng gestures with his mouth) Oh~ Honey, since we both have nothing to do today, should we go out and buy some groceries?
Sure, sure.
(stroking the leaves of a green plant and ends up getting cut) Ouch! That hurts!
What happened, what happened? How could you be so careless? Do you need me to apply some ointment?

content.content: Ah, it's nothing. A little cut like this is no match for a real man. I'll just rest a bit and it'll be fine!
So that's the truth... Before anything happens, there's still a chance to make it right... (dials the emergency number on his phone and turns himself in)
Was I the one embezzling funds?... Things have come to this point, there's no turning back now... (kills Starfish and then himself)
So all of this was because of me! It was my avoidance that led to Starfish's death! I mustn't harm her! (jumps out the window)
Oh, Starfish, you don't need to worry about me. This little cut is nothing to me. I've weathered many storms; a small injury like this is no big deal. Don't worry about it.
Starfish, don't worry about it. I've gotten used to a few nicks here and there. It's really nothing, and I can keep on working. Go tend to your own things!
Oh, Starfish, you're such a good friend. But don't worry, my hand's fine. I'll go get some ointment and put it on in a bit, it'll heal quickly. I've got it, no need for concern.

question: #question#What should Old Deng say to show Starfish that she shouldn't worry about his hand injury?

content.content: It really hurts, could you help me with the ointment? Thanks, my dear~
I'm feeling a bit tired today, could you get the medicine for me? Thank you.
Starfish, I'm feeling a bit off, could you take a look and see what's wrong?
Honey, I have an itch here, could you scratch it for me?

question: #question#What should Old Deng say to express his pain and hope that Starfish will apply ointment for him?

dialog.content: Are you sure you don't need it?
Absolutely sure, I just need to rest a bit.
Then go lie down in the bedroom for a while.
Alright. (Goes to the bedroom and finds the wedding photo shattered, with a piece of rope lying beside it)
Old Deng saw the fragments and remembered everything. He had embezzled public funds, which Haixing discovered. In a panic, he knocked her unconscious and strangled her with a rope.
All done. Be sure not to get it wet, okay? You're such a grown-up yet still so reckless.
Got it, wife. I understand. (Phone rings, answers the call)
Supervisor, the manager is asking for the quarterly report.
Okay, Xiao Liu sent it to me, I’ll forward it to him right away. (Turns on the computer, knocking sound at the door)
Xiao Liu enters Old Deng's house and knocks Haixing unconscious.
